intro: Galium valantia, commonly known as white bedstraw, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, prostrate or ascending stems. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters during the summer months. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Galium valantia thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
